skill.name: apscheduler
skill.description: Advanced Python Scheduler - Task scheduling and job queue system
skill.summary: Advanced Python Scheduler - Task scheduling and job queue system
skill.author: bossjones

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and code examples for the APScheduler Python library. All 54 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the static analyzer misidentified documentation syntax, Python code examples, and placeholder strings as security issues. No actual code execution, network calls, or file operations exist in this skill. It is safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Automate recurring tasks and background jobs in Python applications. APScheduler provides cron, interval, and date-based scheduling with support for persistent storage and distributed execution.
actual_capabilities: Schedule Python functions with cron-style expressions
Run tasks at fixed intervals or specific dates
Persist scheduled jobs across application restarts
Distribute work across multiple scheduler nodes
limitations: Task code must be importable by the scheduler process
Does not provide built-in rate limiting
Monitoring and metrics require manual implementation

use_cases.title: Automate nightly data processing
use_cases.description: Schedule ETL jobs, report generation, and database maintenance tasks to run during off-peak hours.

use_cases.title: Health check and cleanup jobs
use_cases.description: Run periodic system health checks, log rotation, and resource cleanup tasks automatically.

use_cases.title: Background sync operations
use_cases.description: Schedule data synchronization with external APIs, cache refresh, and email dispatch tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic cron schedule
prompt_templates.scenario: Run a task daily at 9 AM
prompt_templates.prompt: Schedule my function send_daily_summary to run every day at 9 AM using APScheduler CronTrigger.

prompt_templates.title: Interval job
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a job that runs refresh_cache() every 30 minutes with APScheduler IntervalTrigger.

prompt_templates.title: Persistent scheduler
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up an AsyncScheduler with SQLAlchemyDataStore using PostgreSQL so jobs survive restarts.

prompt_templates.title: Distributed workers
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a scheduler worker node using AsyncScheduler with SchedulerRole.worker to process jobs from a shared store.

output_examples.input: Schedule my function check_health to run every 5 minutes
output: âœ“ Added schedule with ID: health_check

best_practices: Use persistent data stores in production to preserve jobs across restarts
Set appropriate misfire_grace_time to handle system delays gracefully
Subscribe to job events for monitoring and alerting on failures
anti_patterns: Avoid scheduling very short interval jobs that could overlap and cause resource contention
Do not hardcode schedule IDs - use unique identifiers for reliable management
Avoid blocking job functions without proper executor configuration

faq.question: What triggers does APScheduler support?
faq.answer: APScheduler supports interval, cron, date, and calendar interval triggers for flexible scheduling.

faq.question: How do I make jobs survive restarts?
faq.answer: Use a persistent data store like PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or SQLite instead of in-memory storage.

faq.question: Can I run multiple scheduler instances?
faq.answer: Yes, use AsyncScheduler with event brokers and role-based access for distributed execution.

faq.question: What executors are available?
faq.answer: Thread pool and process pool executors are built-in. Custom executors can be implemented.

faq.question: How do I handle job failures?
faq.answer: Subscribe to JobReleased events and check event.outcome to implement retry logic.

faq.question: Does APScheduler support async functions?
faq.answer: Yes, AsyncScheduler handles both sync and async job functions natively.
